page.title: 01INTRODUCING HORNSEA
page.content: {Hornsea,}often referred to as {"Lakeland by the sea",}is a coastal town with a{resident population}of about{8000.}As a{tourist resort,}the town attracts many summer visitors. These may be day-trippers or holidaymakers staying in hotels, boarding houses or at caravan sites. Many people retire to Hornsea, giving a larger-than-average percentage of Senior Citizens. The town's{attractions include:- The sea, beach and amusement arcades The Mere (Yorkshire's largest fresh-water lake) Floral Hall Burns Farm Museum Hornsea Potteries Hall Garth Park Wilbur's Open Market (Sun. & Wed.) Adventure Playground and BMX Track. {Hull, Beverley}and{Bridlington}are within half an hour's drive from Hornsea.
